paper: ADVMEM_ Adversarial Memory Initialization for Realistic Test-Time Adaptation via Tracklet-Based Benchmarking

differences.summary: Explicit numerical inconsistencies between claimed gains and tables

evidence.baseline_quote: 44% reduction for SHOT-IM cannot be directly matched to a main-paper table.
evidence.final_quote: ‘4% average; 16% pixelate; 10% zoom’ do not align with Appendix Table 5.

differences.summary: ADVMEM no longer presented as superior to TrainMem
differences.why_impacts_score: weakens the claimed advantage and novelty of ADVMEM

evidence.baseline_quote: Head-to-head ... shows ADVMEM outperforming this natural alternative.
evidence.final_quote: TrainMem can be competitive or better for RoTTA under strong non-i.i.d.

differences.summary: Missing method definition (ETA) and batching/tracklet-length mismatch
differences.why_impacts_score: adds reproducibility and baseline identification concerns

evidence.baseline_quote: Memory extensions to TENT/SHOT-IM ... are not fully described.
evidence.final_quote: ETA appears in results but is not defined; ‘exactly one tracklet (64 frames)’ batching unclear.

differences.summary: ADVMEM optimization omissions framed as risking non-termination
differences.why_impacts_score: elevates the severity of methodological risks

evidence.baseline_quote: no α, step count, or convergence criteria beyond fθ(x)=y.
evidence.final_quote: absence risks non-termination and inconsistent behavior.

differences.summary: Primary setting ambiguity: ‘single domain shift’ vs aggregated multi-corruption reporting
differences.why_impacts_score: unclear scope weakens conclusions and comparison validity

evidence.baseline_quote: Ambiguity in what constitutes the primary result.
evidence.final_quote: ‘single domain shift’ stated, yet results aggregate 15 corruptions and emphasize dynamic severities.

differences.summary: Tempered characterization of ADVMEM gains (modest for RoTTA)
differences.why_impacts_score: reduces perceived impact of the proposed method

evidence.baseline_quote: substantial gains for ADVMEM-equipped variants, particularly in tracklet-wise settings.
evidence.final_quote: notable improvements; modest aggregate gains for RoTTA in Appendix Table 5.
